snippet: The study found that arrests of Muslim Americans in plots or violent attacks have dropped sharply since 2009.
abstract: Study finds that arrests of Muslim Americans in plots or violent attacks have dropped sharply since 2009, undermining fears that radicalized Muslims would perpetrate a wave of homegrown terrorist acts; study notes that of the 14,000 murders in the United States in 2011, not a single one resulted from Islamic extremism.
lead_paragraph: The study found that arrests of Muslim Americans in plots or violent attacks have dropped sharply since 2009.

headline.seo: Radical Muslim Americans Pose Little Threat, Study Says
headline.main: Radical U.S. Muslims Little Threat, Study Says
headline.print_headline: U.S. Muslims Rarely Seen In Terror Acts, Study Finds
